newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar steadier in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar steadier in quiet trading.

text.p: White sugar futures posted gains of $0.60 to $2.00 a tonne during quiet Monday trading, as the LCE edged up on modest trade buying, traders said.
Business was slow throughout the session, with the U.S. raws market closed for the Labour Day holiday.
October was $1.30 higher at $350.40, while December gained $2.00 at $346.00. Volume was 908 lots.
Technical analysts said market indicators were neutral, while the October contract was forming a broad top at $355.00 with nearby support at $348.00.
October has now bounced above its 40-day moving average after consolidating in its two previous sessions.
Its 10-day momentum indicator has just crept over the zero mark while the more-sensitive five-day indicator is now approaching zero from negative territory.
